title: Thoughts on Machine Learning – the statistical software R
dc:creator: Florian Hartl
description:
This is going to be an ongoing article series about various aspects of Machine Learning. In the first post of the series I’m going to explain why I decided to learn and use R, and why it is probably the best statistical software for Machine Learning at this time. R vs. popular programming languages like Java Implementing Machine Learning algorithms is not an easy task because it requires a deep understanding of the inner workings of the algorithm. Furthermore, it can make a big difference how the function of a Machine Learning algorithm is implemented in detail because the application of advanced…

The post Thoughts on Machine Learning – the statistical software R appeared first on Florian Hartl.
